description.value: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the {creature}'s allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
A short metal blade mounted to a small hilt and crossguard. The dagger makes an effective side armament for hardened warriors or a hidden blade for assassins and thieves.
A flexible lash of leather affixed to a wooden handle which is capable of flinging rocks or metal bullets with deadly velocity.

A hardened pebble of stone, bone, or metal which can be flung at high velocity using a sling.

**Foundry note: It will usually be impossible to buy one sling bullet because they are worth less than a copper piece (5 bullets = 1 cp).

The kobold uses one of the following options (roll a [[/r 1d8]] or choose one); the kobold can use each one no more than once per day.

d8 Invention
1 Acid
2 Alchemist's Fire
3 Basket of Centipedes
4 Green Slime Pot
5 Rot Grub Pot
6 Scorption on a Stick
7 Skunk in a Cage
8 Wasp Nest in a Bag
The kobold hurls a flask of acid.

The kobold throws a flask of alchemist's fire. Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) fire damage at the start of each of the target's turns.

A creature hit by the alchemist's fire is coated in flames, taking [[/r 1d4]] fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

The kobold throws a small basket into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it. A swarm of insects (centipedes) with 11 hit points emerges from the basket and rolls initiative. At the end of each of the swarm's turns, there's a 50 percent chance that the swarm disperes.

Click here to roll [[/r 1d100]]

The kobold throws a clay pot full of green slime at the target, and it breaks open on impact.

Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. Hit: The target is covered in a patch of freen slime (see chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide). Miss: A patch of green slime covers a randomly determined 5-foot-square section of wall or floow within 5 feet of the target.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: The kobold throws a clay pot into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it, and it breaks open on impact. A swarm of rot grubs emerges from the shattered pot and remains a hazard in that square.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
The kobold makes a melee attack with a scorpion tied to the end of a stick.

On a hit, the target takes 1 piercing damage and must make a DC 9 Constitution saving throw or take 4 (1d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
The kobold releases a skunk into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The skunk has a walking speed of 20 feet, AC 10, 1 hit point, and no effective attacks.

The skunk rolls initiative and, on its turn, uses its action to spray musk at a random creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 9 Constitution saving throw, or it retches and is incapacitated for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that doesn't need to breathe or is immune to poison automatically succeeds on the saving throw. Once the skunk has sprayed its musk, it can't do so until it finishes a short or long rest.

items.name: Invention: Wasp Nest in a Bag

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value: The kobold throws a small bag into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it. A @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-creatures.iSugXvYrQQWtIf6X]{Swarm of Wasps} with 11 hit points emerges from the bag and rolls initiative. At the end of each of the swarm's turns, there's a 50 percent change that the swarm disperses.
